trans-unit.source: Evaluate Recommender
trans-unit.target: Evaluate Recommender

trans-unit.source: Evaluates the accuracy of recommender model predictions
trans-unit.target: Evaluates the accuracy of recommender model predictions

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="EA496474-D04C-474F-896F-3F4531CD8BE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Evaluate</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="EA496474-D04C-474F-896F-3F4531CD8BE0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Evaluate</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module to measure the accuracy of predictions made by a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module to measure the accuracy of predictions made by a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: There are four different kinds of predictions that you can evaluate:
trans-unit.target: There are four different kinds of predictions that you can evaluate:

trans-unit.source: Ratings predicted for a given user and item
trans-unit.target: Ratings predicted for a given user and item

trans-unit.source: Items recommended for a given user
trans-unit.target: Items recommended for a given user

trans-unit.source: A list of users found to be related to a given user
trans-unit.target: A list of users found to be related to a given user

trans-unit.source: A list of items found to be related to a given item
trans-unit.target: A list of items found to be related to a given item

trans-unit.source: Each of these four prediction kinds returns a <legacyBold>scored dataset</legacyBold> with a different column format, containing either user-item-rating triples, users and their recommended items, users and their related users, or items and their related items.
trans-unit.target: Each of these four prediction kinds returns a <legacyBold>scored dataset</legacyBold> with a different column format, containing either user-item-rating triples, users and their recommended items, users and their related users, or items and their related items.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module deduces the kind of prediction from the column format of the scored dataset and applies the appropriate performance metrics.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module deduces the kind of prediction from the column format of the scored dataset and applies the appropriate performance metrics.

trans-unit.source: The performance metrics used are dependent on the kind of prediction made prior to evaluation.
trans-unit.target: The performance metrics used are dependent on the kind of prediction made prior to evaluation.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Recommender</link> module produces scored datasets that can be understood by <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <link xlink:href="55544522-9a10-44bd-884f-9a91a9cec2cd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Recommender</link> module produces scored datasets that can be understood by <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure Evaluate Recommender
trans-unit.target: How to Configure Evaluate Recommender

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module compares the predictions of a recommendation model with the corresponding “ground truth” data to determine the accuracy of predictions.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> module compares the predictions of a recommendation model with the corresponding “ground truth” data to determine the accuracy of predictions.

trans-unit.source: To do this, it requires two inputs:
trans-unit.target: To do this, it requires two inputs:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Test dataset</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Test dataset</ui>.

trans-unit.source: A test dataset that provides <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> with the ground truth data in the form of <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: A test dataset that provides <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> with the ground truth data in the form of <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Splitter</link> module in the <ui>RecommenderSplit</ui> mode to produce a training dataset and a test set from an existing dataset of user-item-rating triples.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link xlink:href="70530644-c97a-4ab6-85f7-88bf30a8be5f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Splitter</link> module in the <ui>RecommenderSplit</ui> mode to produce a training dataset and a test set from an existing dataset of user-item-rating triples.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Scored dataset</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Scored dataset</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The second input, the score dataset, contains the <legacyBold>predictions</legacyBold> from the recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: The second input, the score dataset, contains the <legacyBold>predictions</legacyBold> from the recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned above, the expected column format of the scored dataset depends on the kind of prediction made prior to evaluation.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned above, the expected column format of the scored dataset depends on the kind of prediction made prior to evaluation.

trans-unit.source: The scored dataset might contain user-item-rating triples, users and their recommended items, users and their related users or items and their related items.
trans-unit.target: The scored dataset might contain user-item-rating triples, users and their recommended items, users and their related users or items and their related items.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the names and order of the columns in the scored dataset, different performance metrics are employed in the evaluation.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the names and order of the columns in the scored dataset, different performance metrics are employed in the evaluation.

trans-unit.source: See the following section for more details on the expected column format of the scored dataset and the performance metrics for different kinds of predictions.
trans-unit.target: See the following section for more details on the expected column format of the scored dataset and the performance metrics for different kinds of predictions.

trans-unit.source: Evaluating Rating Predictions
trans-unit.target: Evaluating Rating Predictions

trans-unit.source: In rating prediction, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, is expected to contain <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In rating prediction, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, is expected to contain <legacyBold>user-item-rating triples</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The first column of the dataset must contain the user identifiers.
trans-unit.target: The first column of the dataset must contain the user identifiers.

trans-unit.source: The second column must contain the item identifiers.
trans-unit.target: The second column must contain the item identifiers.

trans-unit.source: The third column must contain the corresponding user-item ratings.
trans-unit.target: The third column must contain the corresponding user-item ratings.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Item</userInput>, and <userInput>Rating</userInput>, respectively.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Item</userInput>, and <userInput>Rating</userInput>, respectively.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> compares the ground truth ratings of the test dataset with the predicted ratings of the scored dataset, computes the <legacyBold>mean absolute error</legacyBold> (MAE) and the <legacyBold>root mean squared error</legacyBold> (RMSE), and returns both metrics in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> compares the ground truth ratings of the test dataset with the predicted ratings of the scored dataset, computes the <legacyBold>mean absolute error</legacyBold> (MAE) and the <legacyBold>root mean squared error</legacyBold> (RMSE), and returns both metrics in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: In rating prediction, other parameter settings of <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> have no effect on evaluation.
trans-unit.target: In rating prediction, other parameter settings of <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> have no effect on evaluation.

trans-unit.source: Evaluating Item Recommendation
trans-unit.target: Evaluating Item Recommendation

trans-unit.source: In item recommendation, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, is expected to list the <legacyBold>recommended items for each user</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In item recommendation, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, is expected to list the <legacyBold>recommended items for each user</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The first column of the dataset must contain the user identifiers.
trans-unit.target: The first column of the dataset must contain the user identifiers.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent columns contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by how relevant an item is to the user (most relevant item first.
trans-unit.target: All subsequent columns contain the corresponding recommended item identifiers, ordered by how relevant an item is to the user (most relevant item first.

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Item 1</userInput>, <userInput>Item 2</userInput>, <userInput>Item 3</userInput> and so forth.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Item 1</userInput>, <userInput>Item 2</userInput>, <userInput>Item 3</userInput> and so forth.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain <legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold> and returns it in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain <legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold> and returns it in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: Since there is no actual ground truth for the recommended items, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> uses the user-item ratings in the test dataset as gains in the computation of the NDCG.
trans-unit.target: Since there is no actual ground truth for the recommended items, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> uses the user-item ratings in the test dataset as gains in the computation of the NDCG.

trans-unit.source: To evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only produce recommendations for items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).
trans-unit.target: To evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only produce recommendations for items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).

trans-unit.source: In item recommendation, the parameter settings of <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> have no effect on evaluation.
trans-unit.target: In item recommendation, the parameter settings of <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> have no effect on evaluation.

trans-unit.source: Evaluating Related Users
trans-unit.target: Evaluating Related Users

trans-unit.source: When evaluating the prediction of related users, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, must contain the <legacyBold>related users for each user of interest</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: When evaluating the prediction of related users, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, the scored dataset, must contain the <legacyBold>related users for each user of interest</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of the users of interest.
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of the users of interest.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent columns contain the identifiers of the predicted related users, ordered by how related they are to the user of interest (most related user first).
trans-unit.target: All subsequent columns contain the identifiers of the predicted related users, ordered by how related they are to the user of interest (most related user first).

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 1</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 2</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 3</userInput>, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>User</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 1</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 2</userInput>, <userInput>Related User 3</userInput>, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain (<legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold>), based on Manhattan (<legacyBold>L1 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) and Euclidean (<legacyBold>L2 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) distances, and returns both values in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain (<legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold>), based on Manhattan (<legacyBold>L1 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) and Euclidean (<legacyBold>L2 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) distances, and returns both values in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: Since there is no actual ground truth for the related users, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> uses the following procedure to compute the average NDCGs.
trans-unit.target: Since there is no actual ground truth for the related users, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> uses the following procedure to compute the average NDCGs.

trans-unit.source: For each user of interest in the scored dataset:
trans-unit.target: For each user of interest in the scored dataset:

trans-unit.source: Find all items in the test dataset which have been rated by both the user of interest and the related user under consideration.
trans-unit.target: Find all items in the test dataset which have been rated by both the user of interest and the related user under consideration.

trans-unit.source: Create two vectors from the ratings of these items, one for the user of interest, and one for the related user under consideration.
trans-unit.target: Create two vectors from the ratings of these items, one for the user of interest, and one for the related user under consideration.

trans-unit.source: Compute the gain as the similarity of the resulting two rating vectors, in terms of their Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.
trans-unit.target: Compute the gain as the similarity of the resulting two rating vectors, in terms of their Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.

trans-unit.source: Compute the L1 Sim NDCG and the L2 Sim NDCG, using the gains of all related users.
trans-unit.target: Compute the L1 Sim NDCG and the L2 Sim NDCG, using the gains of all related users.

trans-unit.source: The shown NDCGs are averaged over all users in the scored dataset.
trans-unit.target: The shown NDCGs are averaged over all users in the scored dataset.

trans-unit.source: Hence, to evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only predict related users who have items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).
trans-unit.target: Hence, to evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only predict related users who have items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).

trans-unit.source: You can influence evaluation by setting the minimum number of items that a user of interest and its related users must have in common.
trans-unit.target: You can influence evaluation by setting the minimum number of items that a user of interest and its related users must have in common.

trans-unit.source: Evaluating Related Item Predictions
trans-unit.target: Evaluating Related Item Predictions

trans-unit.source: When evaluating the prediction of related items, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, scored dataset, must contain the <legacyBold>related items for each item of interest</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: When evaluating the prediction of related items, the second input to <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui>, scored dataset, must contain the <legacyBold>related items for each item of interest</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The first column contains the identifiers of the items of interest.
trans-unit.target: The first column contains the identifiers of the items of interest.

trans-unit.source: All subsequent columns contain the identifiers of the predicted related items, ordered by how related they are to the item of interest (most related item first).
trans-unit.target: All subsequent columns contain the identifiers of the predicted related items, ordered by how related they are to the item of interest (most related item first).

trans-unit.source: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>Item</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 1</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 2</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 3</userInput>, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: For <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> to work, the column names must be <userInput>Item</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 1</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 2</userInput>, <userInput>Related Item 3</userInput>, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain (<legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold>) based on Manhattan (<legacyBold>L1 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) and Euclidean (<legacyBold>L2 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) distances and returns both values in the output dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average normalized discounted cumulative gain (<legacyBold>NDCG</legacyBold>) based on Manhattan (<legacyBold>L1 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) and Euclidean (<legacyBold>L2 Sim NDCG</legacyBold>) distances and returns both values in the output dataset.

trans-unit.source: Since there is no actual ground truth for the related items, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average NDCGs as follows.
trans-unit.target: Since there is no actual ground truth for the related items, <ui>Evaluate Recommender</ui> computes the average NDCGs as follows.

trans-unit.source: For each item of interest in the scored dataset:
trans-unit.target: For each item of interest in the scored dataset:

trans-unit.source: Find all users in the test dataset who have rated both the item of interest and the related item under consideration.
trans-unit.target: Find all users in the test dataset who have rated both the item of interest and the related item under consideration.

trans-unit.source: Create two vectors from the ratings of these users, one for the item of interest and for the related item under consideration.
trans-unit.target: Create two vectors from the ratings of these users, one for the item of interest and for the related item under consideration.

trans-unit.source: Compute the gain as the similarity of the resulting two rating vectors in terms of their Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.
trans-unit.target: Compute the gain as the similarity of the resulting two rating vectors in terms of their Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.

trans-unit.source: Compute the L1 Sim NDCG and the L2 Sim NDCG using the gains of all related items.
trans-unit.target: Compute the L1 Sim NDCG and the L2 Sim NDCG using the gains of all related items.

trans-unit.source: The shown NDCGs are averaged over all items of interest in the scored dataset.
trans-unit.target: The shown NDCGs are averaged over all items of interest in the scored dataset.

trans-unit.source: Hence, to evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only predict related items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).
trans-unit.target: Hence, to evaluate, the recommender scoring module must only predict related items with ground truth ratings (in the test dataset).

trans-unit.source: You can influence evaluation by setting the minimum number of users that an item of interest and its related items must have in common.
trans-unit.target: You can influence evaluation by setting the minimum number of users that an item of interest and its related items must have in common.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how recommendation models are used in Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how recommendation models are used in Azure Machine Learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Movie recommender sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525276</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates how to train, evaluate, and score using a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Movie recommender sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525276</linkUri></externalLink> demonstrates how to train, evaluate, and score using a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Coefficient of relativity
trans-unit.target: Coefficient of relativity

trans-unit.source: The coefficient of relativity between two users is computed as follows:
trans-unit.target: The coefficient of relativity between two users is computed as follows:

trans-unit.source: First, the sets of rated items for each user are extracted from the input data.
trans-unit.target: First, the sets of rated items for each user are extracted from the input data.

trans-unit.source: These sets are then reduced to the items that both users rated in common.
trans-unit.target: These sets are then reduced to the items that both users rated in common.

trans-unit.source: Then, for each item in these sets the rating given by the corresponding user is taken.
trans-unit.target: Then, for each item in these sets the rating given by the corresponding user is taken.

trans-unit.source: This forms two user rating vectors.
trans-unit.target: This forms two user rating vectors.

trans-unit.source: Similarity between these two vectors is computed in terms of Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.
trans-unit.target: Similarity between these two vectors is computed in terms of Manhattan (L1) or Euclidean (L2) distance.

trans-unit.source: This value is then used as a gain in NDCG computation.
trans-unit.target: This value is then used as a gain in NDCG computation.

trans-unit.source: Exception
trans-unit.target: Exception

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of selected columns in input dataset does not equal to the expected number.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more specified columns have type unsupported by current module.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if more than one rating exists for a given user-item pair.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if more than one rating exists for a given user-item pair.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if input dataset is not valid.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if input dataset is not valid.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from specified type into required by target method type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from specified type into required by target method type.
